intro: Hippocrepis scabra subsp. rupestris, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and yellow flowers. The subspecies rupestris is distinguished by its more rugged appearance compared to other subspecies of Hippocrepis scabra. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. This plant is noted for its ecological value, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity in its native range.
